DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Women 18 65 year age IBSD define Rome II criterion . The Rome II criterion system use diagnose functional gastrointestinal disorder irritable bowel syndrome . It involve complete questionnaire gastrointestinal symptom . Patients 50 year age old must colonoscopy OR flexible sigmoidoscopy plus doublecontrast barium enema within past 5 year , demonstrate clinically significant finding . Clinically significant finding may include limited malignant tumor , multiple ( ≥3 ) advance adenoma , inflammatory bowel disease , diverticulitis , ischaemic colitis , lymphocytic colitis , collagenous colitis . Patients must report ≥ 3 day IBSrelated abdominal pain/discomfort plus least 3 day 2 follow event baseline period : ≥ 3 bowel movements/day Bowel urgency Loose watery stool Patients answer `` yes '' either two weekly satisfaction question baseline period . The question : ( 1 ) Over past week satisfactory relief IBSrelated abdominal pain/discomfort ? ( 2 ) Over last week satisfactory relief overall IBSD symptom ? Patients hard lumpy stool one day baseline period . Lactose intolerant patient relieve lactose free diet . Use antidepressant ( tricyclic , SSRI etc ) , opioid analgesic drug drug specifically affect bowel motility course trial . Women childbearing potential use acceptable method contraception . Pregnant nursing ( lactate ) woman . Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
